# Syre

<!-- badges: start -->
[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/syre)](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=syre)
<!-- badges: end -->

Scientific data management and analysis.

## Installation

``` r
packages.install(<path/to/syre.tar.gz>, repos = NULL, type = "source")
```

## About
> Full documentation at [syre.ai](https://www.syre.ai).

Syre is a framework for managing and analyzing data. Syre utilizes **top-down organization** and **bottom-up analysis** to make analyzing your data and drawing conclusions easy. This allows your data and analysis to stay separate and modular.

## Example

```{r example}
library(syre)

db <- database(dev_root = "/path/to/my/syre/project/data/container")
asset <- db |> find_asset(type = "raw_data")
# ...
asset_[atj]
```
